column1: Ischemic ulcers (wounds) can occur when there is poor blood flow in your legs.
Most ischemic ulcers occur on the feet and legs.
Clogged arteries (atherosclerosis) are the most common cause of ischemic ulcers.
Often people with poor blood flow also have nerve damage or foot ulcers from diabetes.

Other conditions that can cause ischemic wounds include: - Diabetes - Diseases that cause inflammation, such as lupus - High blood pressure - Kidney failure - Lymphedema, which causes fluid to build up in the legs - Smoking
